dt: {bc}to appeal to or cite as authority

quotes.t: We began poring over the typewritten recipes at the dining room table, where I foolishly {qword}invoked{/qword} the name of Julia Child …
There are some people who commit murder as a way of {qword}invoking{/qword} the death penalty. Capital punishment can sometimes, then, be equivalent to suicide.
Nietzsche is so complex that he can be {qword}invoked{/qword} in support of many outlooks, some of them brutal or nihilistic.

et: Middle English {it}envoken{/it}, from Middle French {it}invoquer{/it}, from Latin {it}invocare{/it}, from {it}in-{/it} + {it}vocare{/it} to call, from {it}voc-, vox{/it} voice {ma}{mat|voice|}{/ma}
shortdef: to petition for help or support
to appeal to or cite as authority
to call forth by incantation : conjure
